covered: POST Method - Valid Payload: Tests cover successful account creation with minimum required fields (TC01) and with all optional fields (TC02), including scenarios with extra, unsupported fields which are ignored (TC07).
POST Integration: Creation via POST followed by retrieval through GET (TC20).
POST Invalid Payload: Malformed JSON (TC05), missing required fields (TC06), and empty payload (TC12) lead to 400.
POST Large Payloads: Maximum field sizes tested (TC11).
POST Validation: Header validation and authorization (missing header TC04, invalid header types TC08, and unauthorized access (TC09)).
POST Server Error Handling: System down / database unavailable yields 503 (TC10).
Edge cases: XSS/Injection handling (TC15) and additional header/field variations (TC04, TC08, TC09, TC16, TC17).
Performance/Resilience: Concurrency (TC18) and timeout (TC14) scenarios covered.
Constraint handling: Duplicate account data handling tested (TC13).
Response content: Created Account object present in response body for successful POST (TC01/TC02/TC03/TC07/TC11/TC16/TC20).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No dedicated tests for rate limiting or throttling in POST operations (e.g., 429 responses).
Caching Behavior: No tests validating caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) or caching behavior on POST or subsequent GET.
Observability: No explicit audit/logging/metrics checks for account creation events.
recommendations: Add explicit rate-limiting tests to verify throttling behavior and 429 responses under high load.
Add tests for caching behavior (ETag, Cache-Control) and validate caching behavior on GET of created accounts (e.g., conditional GET).
Add observability tests to verify audit logs/metrics for account creation events.
